title: artists-vignette
text: vignette describes use functions package “artists”. five functions: Topsongslyrics TopAlbum Compare.year Compare.lyrics Geniusdashboard vignette explain use functions examples.

title: artists-vignette
text: function returns top 10 songs artists like lyrics. also possibility print term frequency graph, worlcloud return directly environment following variables: df, token, corpus, dtm, freq covariance matrix. Example use artist Lady Gaga:
code: # Topsongslyrics( #   name = "Lady Gaga", #   tfgraph = TRUE, #   wordcloud = TRUE, #   lang = "en", #   environment.return = TRUE, #   local = TRUE # )

title: artists-vignette
text: functions returns name released year albums artists like. Example use artist Lana Del Rey:

title: artists-vignette
text: functions returns density plot year activity & popularity two artists like. Example use artists Lady Gaga Lana Del Rey:
code: # compare.year("lady gaga", "lana del rey", local = TRUE)

title: artists-vignette
text: function returns plot compares lyrics two artists like. Example use artists Lady Gaga Lana Del Rey:

title: artists-vignette
text: functions launches shiny app dashboard following interactions: choosing one artist choice dashboard displays term frequency plot, average sentiment plot, sentiments song plot sentiments globally plot. choosing two artists choice dashboard displays two artists comparison popular albums distribution, LDA analysis theta plot phi plot, keyness plot. Example use:

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: repository can download artists package provides use following five functions: Topsongslyrics TopAlbum Compare.year Compare.lyrics Geniusdashboard

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: function returns top 10 songs artists like lyrics. also possibility print term frequency graph, worlcloud return directly environment following variables: df, token, corpus, dtm, freq covariance matrix.

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: functions returns name released year albums artists like.

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: functions returns density plot year activity & popularity two artists like.

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: function returns plot compares lyrics two artists like.

title: Top artists songs and albums
text: functions launches shiny app dashboard following interactions: choosing one artist choice dashboard displays term frequency plot, average sentiment plot, sentiments song plot sentiments globally plot. choosing two artists choice dashboard displays two artists comparison popular albums distribution, LDA analysis theta plot phi plot, keyness plot. Installing package: #> install.packages(“devtools”) library(devtools) install_github(“ptds2022/artists”) library(artists) #> Enjoy new functions !

title: Geniusdashboard — Geniusdashboard
text: Geniusdashboard

title: Geniusdashboard — Geniusdashboard
text: artists dataframe one column containing artists want. lang dataframe one column containing abrevations languages want (example: English must "en").

title: Geniusdashboard — Geniusdashboard
text: returns dashboard

title: Geniusdashboard — Geniusdashboard
text: Emile Paris

title: Top Albums — TopAlbums
text: Top Albums

title: Top Albums — TopAlbums
text: name name artist choice. local determine function run locally .

title: Top Albums — TopAlbums
text: Return name albums year release specific artist (name).

title: Top Albums — TopAlbums
text: Emile Paris

title: Top Albums — TopAlbums
code: if (FALSE) { TopAlbums("Lana Del Rey", local = TRUE) }

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
text: Top songs lyrics

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
code: Topsongslyrics(   name,   tfgraph = FALSE,   wordcloud = FALSE,   lang,   environment.return = TRUE,   local = TRUE )

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
text: name name artist choice. tfgraph True, returns term-frequency graph. wordcloud True, returns worldcloud. lang Language lyrics. environment.return True, saves computations global environment. local determine function run locally .

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
text: returns dataframe 10 top songs lyrics given  artist (name) speaking special language (lang). Possibility print Term frequency graph wordcloud. Also, possibility return directly environment df, token, corpus, dtm, freq, covariance matrix.

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
text: Emile Paris

title: Top songs lyrics — Topsongslyrics
code: if (FALSE) { Topsongslyrics(name = "Lady Gaga",                tfgraph = TRUE,                wordcloud = TRUE,                lang = "en",                environment.return = TRUE,                local = TRUE) }
